III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio
Section (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
Description supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval
checks shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 fell asleep while supervising youth on the evening of
05/15/2025.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face
visit to the facility on 06/03/2025. She recalled a recent night
when the house lost power during a thunderstorm. Youth A
recalled several of the youth waking up and leaving their
bedrooms and congregating in the living room. Youth A recalled
seeing Staff 1 asleep on the couch as this occurred. Youth A
commented that she has seen Staff 1 asleep on other occasions
while working overnight shifts.
Youth B was interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face
visit to the facility on 06/03/2025. She reported youth woke up to
the power being out in the home. Youth B believed that she had
seen Staff 1 asleep on the couch holding her cell phone at that
time. Youth B did not believe Staff 1 was asleep long and recalled
Staff 1 interacting with the youth as the maintenance staff came to
the home to set up generators for power.
Youth C was interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face
visit to the facility on 06/03/2025. She could not recall any
occasions where she had seen Staff 1 asleep working overnight
shifts.
Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 were interviewed during an
announced, face-to-face visit to the facility on 6/17/25.
Administrator 1 confirmed Staff 1 had been taken off the schedule
because of the concerns present in video footage showing she
had fallen asleep while on shift at the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 06/26/2025. Staff 1
confirmed she often works at the facility during overnight shifts
when the youth are sleeping. She described her responsibilities
as making eyes on checks of the youth while they are in
2

bed. Staff 1 stated being responsible for basic household tasks
like helping with laundry and cleaning. She stated it was common
for a youth to get up to go to the bathroom or not be sleeping as
she did her checks, and she would respond to anything they
needed. Staff 1 recalled the date when there was a power outage
at the house during a thunderstorm. She believed there were a
few youth that had woken up that night and came to the living
room. Staff 1 denied falling asleep during that night. Staff 1
stated that there have been other times where it was difficult to
stay awake and she may have drifted off to sleep briefly on
occasion. Staff 1 believed there had never been an instance
where a youth was not safe or did not have their needs met
because of a staff that may have briefly fallen asleep.
Video reviewed:
• Security video footage clips were provided and reviewed.
o On 06/07/2025 Staff 1 could be seen asleep at
2:58AM. She was sitting slumped on the couch in
the living room area. Her left hand was up near her
face, supporting her head. Staff 1 was seen asleep
in this clip until at least 3:14AM.
o On 06/09/2025 Staff 1 could be seen sitting at the
dining room table. At 5:46AM Staff 1 was seen
sitting in a chair with both hands tucked in her
hooded sweatshirt pocket. Staff 1 appeared asleep
and did not move until 6:09AM.
o On 06/10/2025 at 4:23AM Staff 1 could be seen
sitting on the couch in the living room area. Staff 1
was leaning to her right with her right hand
supporting her head. She briefly moved and
scratched her back, then appeared still and asleep
as she did not move from 4:25AM through 4:40AM.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility policy title “Third Shift Policy/Bed Checks” was
provided and reviewed. This policy stated staff “must
remain upright and alert. They may not recline or be
covered by blankets and should conduct themselves in a
way where it is obvious from observation that they are not
sleeping.”
• Personnel documentation for Staff 1 was reviewed. She
had no records of discipline in her file. She was put on
administrative leave as of 06/13/2025 and her employment
was terminated as of 06/27/2025.
• Facility documentation titled “Third Shift Bed Checks” was
provided and reviewed. It is noted this form prefills times of
3

bed checks. On 06/07/2025, 06/09/2025 and 06/10/2025
Staff 1 completed this documentation, and it stated she
completed variable eyes on checks within fifteen minute
intervals for those complete nights. On 06/07/2025 Staff 1
documented eyes on checks of all youth at 2:52AM, on
06/09/2025 at 5:55AM and on 06/10/2025 at 4:29AM.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed Staff 1 fell asleep while
supervising youth on multiple occasions failing to complete
varying interval checks when youth were asleep. The times listed
on the Third Shift Bed Check documentation was not accurate
because it was prefilled on the form template and did not allow
staff to input the time the bed check was actually completed.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
